title: Solutions Engineer - Cellular DAS & RAN (Western U.S.)
descriptionHtml:
North America In-Building Networks Solutions Engineer

*Must be located in Western region or willing to relocate without assistance

** Must be U.S. Citizen or Green Card Holder


Scope of Position:

As a Solutions Engineer, you will be responsible for pre-sales support of Airspan’s cellular DAS and RAN products for Carrier and Enterprise opportunities. Support includes customer meetings, opportunity development, DAS and RAN system design support, proposal activities, product education opportunities (tradeshows, customer and partner training), and engagement with internal product management/development and marketing teams.


Responsibilities:

  • Contribute as the Subject Matter Expert on Airspan RAN and DAS equipment and complementary solutions and architectures for Airspan sales team, customers, VARs/Partners, and distributors.
  • Partner with the Airspan Sales Managers, RF Design Engineering and Product Management teams in pre-sales engagements, opportunity qualification and proposal activity.
  • Assist Customers and Partners in product, technology, and design related questions during the pre-sales phase of projects.
  • Provide educational seminars to Customers and Partners with focus on Airspan equipment configurations, recommended practices, and relevant tools/resources.
  • Engage Product Development to define customer requirements and feature requests relative to current and future product portfolio.
  • Support use case analysis and comparison of new/existing/competitive products to determine proper positioning within market.
  • Create and maintain tools to improve speed and accuracy of pricing estimates, bills of materials, and other customer-facing outputs.


Experience and Desired Skill Sets:

  • Bachelor of Science, Engineering or related discipline
  • 5+ years of experience in wireless telecommunications field with experience as Product Manager, RF Engineer, Sales Engineer or related positions
  • Thorough understanding of various RF concepts and tools (e.g. iBwave design, Link Budgets, RF planning, SINR, etc.) and wireless technologies (e.g. LTE, 5G NR, CBRS, mmWave, 802.11, etc.)
  • Experience with RAN, LAN, WAN, IP, IPSec, Switching, Routing and other IP-based solutions related to business applications
  • Excellent presentation skills
  • Experience in direct sales to all levels of an organization up to CxO level engagements
  • Ability to work within an opportunity-centric team and handle multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Demonstrated ability to build relationships with partners and customers to provide continued support and drive future sales
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills


Travel: Domestic travel of approximately 50%

Hours: Full-time, 40 hours/week+

jobPosterTitle: Talent Acquisition Professional helping to drive organizational success!
jobFunction: Engineering, Product Management, and Business Development
companySlogan: MEETING THE DEMANDS FOR FUTURE 5G
companyDescription: Airspan is a U.S.-based provider of groundbreaking, disruptive software and hardware for 5G networks, and a pioneer in end-to-end Open RAN solutions that are interoperable with other vendors. As a result of our innovative technology and significant R&D investments to build and expand our 5G solutions portfolio, Airspan is well positioned with Open RAN, private networks, fixed wireless access (FWA), and CBRS solutions, providing solutions to tier 1 mobile network operators to deploy their networks of the future, today. With over one million cells shipped to 1,000 customers in more than 100 countries, Airspan has global scale.

title: Senior Solution Architect / Consultant / or Sales Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Cyara is the world’s leading Automated CX Assurance Platform provider, helping leading brands across the globe deliver better CX with less effort, cost, and risk. Cyara supports the entire CX software development lifecycle, from design to functional and regression testing, load testing, chatbot testing, and production monitoring, ensuring enterprises can build flawless customer journeys across voice and digital channels while reducing the risk of customer-facing defects. Every day, the most recognizable brands across the globe trust Cyara to deliver customer smiles at scale. Interested to find out more about us? Check out: www.cyara.com


Want to know what it’s really like to work at Cyara? Check out this link to meet some real Cyaran’s and read about their individual career journey with us: https://cyara.com/employee-profiles/


Cyara’s Diversity, Equity, Inclusive and Belonging Statement:

At Cyara, we are dedicated to fostering a workplace that embodies equal opportunity and champions diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB). We strive to cultivate an environment where every individual feels valued, respected, and empowered to bring their whole selves to work, contributing unique perspectives and talents. Our commitment includes continuously evaluating and enhancing our policies, practices, and culture to align with our DEIB principles. We ensure a discrimination-free environment where individuals are evaluated solely on their merits and abilities, regardless of legally protected statuses such as sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or medical condition. By celebrating our differences and championing inclusivity, we enrich our organization, make more thoughtful decisions, and drive collective success.


Cyara’s Values Statement: At Cyara, our values shape everything we do. We're passionate about Delivering Excellence by putting the customer first, collaborating globally, and always striving to improve. We take smart risks and Innovate Boldly, setting new standards and learning from every experience. Integrity First is our cornerstone—we value humility, authenticity, and respect for diversity, building trust in all we do. We Embrace Curiosity by empowering you to experiment, learn, and grow in a dynamic environment. At Cyara, our values drive us forward, shaping a culture where innovation and excellence thrive.


We are looking for an experienced Sr. Solutions Architect to join our dynamic team. This role involves working closely with sales teams to architect solutions that meet prospective customers' complex requirements, demonstrating the value of Cyara in enhancing their CX strategies. You will be instrumental in building trust with potential customers, understanding their needs, and designing tailored solutions that highlight the capabilities and benefits of Cyara's testing and monitoring solutions.


Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with sales teams to understand prospective customers' business challenges and technical requirements, aligning them with Cyara solutions.
  • Develop and present customized demonstrations of Cyara's platform, highlighting its value in improving CX testing and monitoring.
  • Architect and propose solutions that integrate Cyara's platform with customers' existing technology stacks, ensuring seamless operation and optimization of their CX strategies.
  • Engage with customer stakeholders to gather requirements, discuss potential solutions, and provide expert advice on Cyara's capabilities.
  • Respond to technical queries and concerns during the sales process, ensuring customers' and prospects' technical requirements are addressed effectively.
  • Stay updated with the latest developments in CX technologies, Cyara platform updates, and industry best practices to provide insightful recommendations to customers.
  • Facilitate smooth transition of new customers to the implementation team, ensuring clear communication of the proposed solutions and customer expectations.
  • Contribute to the development of best practices, case studies, and other materials to enhance the pre-sales process and highlight the value of Cyara solutions.


Let’s talk about your skills/expertise:

  • 8+ Years in a presale's role presenting to C and V level prospects.
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field experience.
  • Proven experience as a Solutions Architect, Sales Engineer, or similar role, preferably with a focus on CX, call centre, IVR or related technologies.
  • Strong technical acumen, with the ability to design solutions and integrate complex systems.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with a proven ability to engage and persuade technical and business audiences.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a consultative approach to addressing customer needs.
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with sales teams and other internal stakeholders.
  • Willingness to travel as needed to meet with customers, tradeshows, corporate events globally and participate in sales engagements.


$170,000 - $200,000 a year

This range indicates OTE. Individual pay is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location.


Why you should join us:

At Cyara you’ll have the opportunity to work with a group of people who share common goals, are driven by a similar passion, and value the expertise of their peers. Cyara is committed to being an equal opportunity employer, focused on building and maintaining a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace; and a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment, based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy. At Cyara we appreciate and welcome the fact that our culture is living and growing as we continue to evolve over time. With this opportunity comes the chance to enjoy a flexible work environment, competitive compensation and a work culture that's results-oriented, fast-paced and focused on continuous improvement, whilst maintaining a family first, team oriented, and ever positive atmosphere.


Cyara cares for its own - you’ll feel that on your first day - and you'll get the chance to work for a global, growing company, and an all-inclusive team of innovators. We credit our amazing growth and success to the fact that we’ve built our business on four essential values that we live and breathe every day:

Deliver Excellence

Innovate Boldly

Integrity First

Embrace Curiosity

companySlogan: Cyara's AI-Powered CX Transformation Platform Helps Businesses Evolve to Meet Customers' Expectations
companyDescription:
Cyara revolutionizes the way businesses transform and optimize their customer experiences. Cyara’s AI-based CX Transformation Platform empowers enterprises to deliver flawless interactions across voice, video, digital, and chatbot experiences. With Cyara, businesses improve customer journeys through continuous innovation while reducing cost and minimizing risk. With a 96% customer retention rate and world-class Net Promoter Score (NPS), today’s leading global brands trust Cyara every day to deliver customer smiles at scale.

To learn more, visit cyara.com

title: Senior System Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Corsair Technical Services (corsairtechnicalservices.com) is a veteran-owned small business dedicated to delivering high-quality solutions to government and industry clients. With expertise in instructional systems engineering analysis, supportability engineering, logistics services, and business capture and proposal development, Corsair combines technical excellence with mission-driven service


Corsair is seeking a self-driven, pragmatic Senior Systems Engineer to join a dynamic, cross-functional team of multidisciplinary professionals. This role spans the full system life cycle—from requirements development and analysis to risk management, integration, testing, verification, and operations. Ideal candidates will bring a systems-thinking mindset and a passion for fostering a collaborative, systems-oriented culture.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Champion technical processes for system engineering and product development
  • Complete requirements development for functional, performance, and interface requirements
  • Support gated reviews including SRR, PDR, CDR for unmanned aircraft system development program(s)
  • Participate in system trade studies and functional decomposition
  • Coordinate with hardware and software teams to ensure seamless integration
  • Maintain configuration management and documentation of integrated systems
  • Develop test plans, procedures, and cases
  • Conduct system verification and validation testing
  • Analyze test results and document findings
  • Coordinate with quality assurance teams to ensure compliance with testing standards
  • You will work with the engineering disciplines to develop subsystem and system level test plans that verify that requirements are met
  • You will perform and maintain Functional Hazard Assessments (FHA), Fault Tree Analyses (FTA), and Failure Modes and Effects Analyses (FMEA)
  • You will support the creation of product lifecycle analyses in support of system reliability and maintainability.


Qualifications Required:

  • U.S. Citizen
  • At least 10 years of experience in Systems Engineering - Aerospace systems engineering preferred
  • Experience managing requirements traceability and evolution through the system development cycle
  • Hands-on lab and field test engineering experience
  • Experience in R&D environments including physical integration of hardware
  • Familiarity with electronics and systems related to image collection and analysis
  • Has developed systems test plans, procedures, and reports and reviewed and interpreted specifications
  • Proficiency with C/C++ and MATLAB required
  • Developed instrumented flight test vectors and data acquisition
  • Allocated requirements to subsystem & engineering coordination
  • Experience in R&D environments including physical integration of hardware
  • Troubleshooting and Root Cause Analysis
  • Writing Systems Safety protocols and ensuring personnel safety during field testing
  • Must be able to travel occasionally



Qualifications Desired:

  • Experience with unmanned aviation programs
  • Experience Writing Systems Safety protocols and ensuring personnel safety during field testing
  • Knowledge of Simulink, Ansys and SolidWorks preferred
  • Exposure to Guidance Navigation and Control Systems along with Modeling Simulation & Control and Model-Based Systems Engineering is helpful but not required
  • Advanced degree is preferred



Education:

  • Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science/Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace, or Mechanical Engineering is required or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience



Join our team of highly talented professionals who are motivated to make our customers’ programs a success. Corsair Technical Services employees are committed to leading and setting the highest standards with pride and professionalism.


Pay Rate: $165K to $170K


To Apply: https://phg.tbe.taleo.net/phg01/ats/careers/v2/viewRequisition?org=CORSAIR&cws=44&rid=611


Corsair Technical Services is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

companySlogan: Providing high-fidelity training systems, strategy & proposal support, supportability engineering, & logistics services.
companyDescription: Corsair Technical Services is a veteran-owned small business providing strategy-driven capture management; mission readiness analysis and tools; maintenance and logistics expertise; and a broad spectrum of training products and services. Corsair’s customers comprise all of the major aerospace defense contractors as well as the U.S. Army, Air Force, Navy, and Marine Corps. Experience includes fixed and rotary wing aircraft; unmanned aerial systems; ground defense systems; and space exploration systems for both domestic and international customers. Founded in 1994, Corsair has a long legacy of helping our clients achieve successful outcomes. Our standard is defined by doing the right thing for our customers and our people.

title: Cloud Platform Engineer
descriptionHtml:
hackajob is collaborating with Verisk to connect them with exceptional tech professionals for this role.

Job Description

The ideal candidate should have experience working in securely governed multi-account cloud environments and will follow Verisk best practices for security and data governance. Additionally, the individual will take end-to-end ownership of team projects which may coordinate with business-facing teams.

The Cloud Platform Engineer position requires in-depth knowledge of primarily AWS cloud infrastructure at the Solutions Architect level of proficiency. The successful candidate will be able to rapidly apply their AWS infrastructure knowledge to real-world business problems constrained by specific security policies, and creatively define and implement new solutions that advance Verisk data analytic capabilities.

This role requires significant experience in cloud computing environments, hands on technical skills, a passion and appetite to master new technologies, and excellent communication skills. The Cloud Platform Engineer must enjoy interacting with diverse and globally distributed technical teams and maintain a mindset focused on helping others succeed in the cloud computing projects.

Responsibilities

Define, deploy, and manage AWS infrastructure resources such as EC2, RDS, IAM roles/polices, security groups, and lambda functions via CICD processes and infrastructure-as-code scripts while adhering to Verisk best practices for security and compliance.

Due to the sensitive nature of Verisk data assets, the individual will follow and help to refine standard processes and must demonstrate attention to detail.

Assist with monitoring and evaluation of cloud resources with respect to Verisk compliance and remediation of issues found.

Contribute to technical design of project architectures; evaluate security exposure, cost, and maintenance aspects of proposed solutions; propose alternative solutions to optimize approaches.

Research emerging cloud technologies and evaluate technical merit, such as performance and governance, through the definition and rapid execution of proof-of-concept projects.

Assist internal teams with cloud requirements and understanding of AWS services as well as Verisk policies for best practice and compliance.

Assist in troubleshooting end-user issues associated with utilizing deployed AWS resources.

Interact with AWS staff assigned to assist Verisk.

Qualifications

Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with a degree in Computer Science or equivalent.

Ability to lead projects to support internal customers and communicate effectively.

Proficient in deploying and managing containerized applications using Amazon EKS and ECS. Demonstrated ability to ensure secure, scalable, and efficient Kubernetes deployments.

Expertise in Linux operating systems, writing and managing AWS scripting for automation and task optimization within cloud environments.

Comprehensive knowledge of AWS networking concepts, including VPC endpoints, PrivateLink, VPC peering, and overall VPC architecture. Ability to design and manage secure and efficient network topologies.

Experienced in creating and updating infrastructure as code using tools like AWS CloudFormation, Terraform, and AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK). Skilled in managing state files and troubleshooting IaC deployments to ensure reliability and compliance.

Extensive experience with AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM). Proficient in refining and implementing IAM policies to align with Verisk's stringent security standards, ensuring robust data and resource governance.

In-depth understanding of AWS database services, including RDS, DynamoDB, and Aurora.

Completion of AWS Certified Solutions Architect (or similar) certification preferred.

Experience common industry security standards with application to cloud compliance.

Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.

Must be detail-oriented and able to multi-task to meet standard response times and deadlines.

About Us

For over 50 years, Verisk has been the leading data analytics and technology partner to the global insurance industry by delivering value to our clients through expertise and scale. We empower communities and businesses to make better decisions on risk, faster.

At Verisk, you'll have the chance to use your voice and build a rewarding career that's as unique as you are, with work flexibility and the support, coaching, and training you need to succeed.

For the eighth consecutive year, Verisk is proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work® for outstanding workplace culture in the US, fourth consecutive year in the UK, Spain, and India, and second consecutive year in Poland. We value learning, caring and results and make inclusivity and diversity a top priority. In addition to our Great Place to Work® Certification, we’ve been recognized by The Wall Street Journal as one of the Best-Managed Companies and by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and Best Employer for Women, testaments to the value we place on workplace culture.

We’re 7,000 people strong. We relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation. And we are looking for people like you to help us translate big data into big ideas. Join us and create an exceptional experience for yourself and a better tomorrow for future generations.

Verisk Businesses

Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient

Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.

Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance

Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing,relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement

Life Insurance Solutions - offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.

Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. Verisk’s minimum hiring age is 18 except in countries with a higher age limit subject to applicable law.

Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

Skilled in managing state files and troubleshooting IaC deployments to ensure reliability and compliance.Extensive experience with AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM). Proficient in refining and implementing IAM policies to align with Verisk's stringent security standards, ensuring robust data and resource governance.In-depth understanding of AWS database services, including RDS, DynamoDB, and Aurora.Completion of AWS Certified Solutions Architect (or similar) certification preferred.Experience common industry security standards with application to cloud compliance.Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.Must be detail-oriented and able to multi-task to meet standard response times and deadlines.About UsFor over 50 years, Verisk has been the leading data analytics and technology partner to the global insurance industry by delivering value to our clients through expertise and scale. We empower communities and businesses to make better decisions on risk, faster.At Verisk, you'll have the chance to use your voice and build a rewarding career that's as unique as you are, with work flexibility and the support, coaching, and training you need to succeed.For the eighth consecutive year, Verisk is proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work® for outstanding workplace culture in the US, fourth consecutive year in the UK, Spain, and India, and second consecutive year in Poland. We value learning, caring and results and make inclusivity and diversity a top priority. In addition to our Great Place to Work® Certification, we’ve been recognized by The Wall Street Journal as one of the Best-Managed Companies and by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and Best Employer for Women, testaments to the value we place on workplace culture.We’re 7,000 people strong. We relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation. And we are looking for people like you to help us translate big data into big ideas. Join us and create an exceptional experience for yourself and a better tomorrow for future generations.Verisk BusinessesUnderwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precisionClaims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiencesProperty Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficientExtreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governanceMarketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing,relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagementLife Insurance Solutions - offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become strongerVerisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. Verisk’s minimum hiring age is 18 except in countries with a higher age limit subject to applicable law.Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

title: Devops Engineer with Database experience
descriptionHtml:
We are looking for DevOps Engineer- with some Postgres or other sql DBA experience (20% of the time). This is a full-time permanent hire position with our client. You can work 100% remote (anywhere in USA) for this position. In this role as a DevOps Engineer- Postgres DBA, you will be responsible for company s cloud environments, components-maintenance, optimization, issue analysis, automation, consulting and planning of cloud solutions. You should be able to work within established processes, and be able to leverage the latest tools, automation, and best practices.


Responsibilities for a DevOps Engineer- Postgres or SQL:

  • Design, create and maintain company s cloud solutions
  • Automate cloud related tasks
  • Maintain cloud environments in Azure and AWS
  • Automating service deployment and maintenance tasks
  • Creating database structures, tables, views, stored procedures, and indexes to efficiently store and retrieve data.
  • Perform data loading, updates, and deletion operations while maintaining data consistency and accuracy.
  • Monitor database performance, identifying bottlenecks, and implementing tuning strategies to improve query response times.
  • Define user access controls, managing permissions, and implementing security measures to protect sensitive data.
  • Actively monitor database health, identifying potential issues, and resolving database related errors and anomalies.
  • Proactively assess database storage needs and scaling infrastructure to accommodate future data growth.
  • Apply software updates and patches to maintain database compatibility and security
  • This position will have an on call rotation (one week every 5-6 weeks) and late night deployments as needed


Required Skills as a DevOps Engineer- Postgres or SQL:

  • 8+ years of hands-on experience in an Infrastructure related role
  • 4+ years of experience building, delivering, and managing public private and hybrid cloud computing platforms (Azure /AWS) and other open source and commercial DevOps technologies
  • 4+ years of hands-on experience working with Docker, Kubernetes, and Terraform
  • Ability to read and write complex scripts to automate system deployment, troubleshooting, and maintenance
  • Experience using source code management tools
  • Experience with relational databases (MSSQL, MySQL, Postgres) with the ability to write SQL commands and identify and resolve performance issues
  • Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or equivalent experience
  • Managed Services experience, e.g. ITSM & ITIL, for a plus
  • Valid certificates in either AWS, Azure, Google or Oracle cloud is a huge plus

title: Solutions Architect
descriptionHtml:
Solution Architect – Enterprise Systems

Remote (U.S. Only) | No Sponsorship Available

Salary: $140K–$180K + 10% Annual Bonus

Full-Time | Industry: Manufacturing / Transportation

About the Role

We are seeking a hands-on Solution Architect – Enterprise Systems to drive the technical strategy, architecture, and delivery of scalable business solutions. This role blends enterprise thinking with real-world execution. You’ll shape our technology roadmap, evaluate tools and platforms, architect solutions, and help build a modern engineering culture—without direct people management.

You’ll work closely with the PMO, business stakeholders, developers, and vendors to design future-ready systems across ERP, CRM, data platforms, and cloud infrastructure. This is an individual contributor role that requires both strategic foresight and technical depth.

Key Responsibilities

  • Technology Strategy & Roadmapping – Define technology vision, evaluate platforms, guide investments
  • Enterprise Architecture – Design high-quality, scalable, and secure architectures for business systems
  • Solution Delivery – Serve as the technical lead across ERP, CRM, and integration-heavy projects
  • Engineering Culture – Help instill best practices and guide developers in building strong technical foundations
  • Technology Selection – Evaluate and prototype tools and platforms for fit, feasibility, and scalability
  • Stakeholder Engagement – Work cross-functionally with business, product, and technical teams
  • Integration Leadership – Oversee system integrations with a focus on performance, resilience, and extensibility


Top Requirements

  • Experience building technical roadmaps and leading enterprise-wide technology strategy
  • Broad technical expertise across multiple platforms (ERP, CRM, Cloud, Data, Infrastructure)
  • Experience in consulting or client-facing enterprise delivery is a strong plus
  • Comfortable operating in a mission-driven, startup-paced, high-impact environment

🔧 Core Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
  • 12+ years in IT, with 8+ years in enterprise solution architecture
  • Hands-on experience across Azure data services (Data Factory, MS Fabric, Data Lake, SQL DB, etc.)
  • Experience with Salesforce, ERP platforms (SAP, JDE, PeopleSoft), and cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP)
  • Strong background in custom development, packaged apps, integrations, and infrastructure
  • Familiarity with Agile/DevOps delivery methodologies
  • Experience influencing without authority; ability to lead technical initiatives cross-functionally
  • Bonus: Experience in manufacturing, transportation, or insurance/underwriting domains
  • Bonus: Exposure to AI/ML, certifications in Salesforce, Azure, or other enterprise platforms

title: DevOps Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Who We Are:


RegEd is the market-leading provider of RegTech enterprise solutions with relationships with hundreds of enterprise clients, including 80% of the top 25 financial services firms.

Established in 2000 by former regulators, the company is recognized for continuous regulatory technology innovation with solutions hallmarked by workflow-directed processes, data integration, regulatory intelligence, automated validations, business process automation and compliance dashboards. The aggregate drives the highest levels of operational efficiency and enables our clients to cost-effectively comply with regulations and continuously mitigate risk.

Trusted by the nation’s top financial services firms, RegEd’s proven, holistic approach to RegTech meets firms where they are on the compliance and risk management continuum, scaling as their needs evolve and amplifying the value proposition delivered to clients.


Life at RegEd:


We are an innovative, fast-paced company that embraces diversity. Our remote or hybrid environment blends an entrepreneurial culture with the right balance of structure and process. We empower and trust our employees. Most RegEder’s work remotely, and some roles work a hybrid schedule from our Headquarters in Morrisville, North Carolina. Learn more about #LifeAtRegEd on our LinkedIn page!


Diversity Drives Innovation:


RegEd believes that diverse perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and more innovative. We are committed to building a workplace where everyone feels seen, heard, and empowered to succeed. We actively seek individuals from all backgrounds and are committed to cultivating an environment of inclusivity and belonging. RegEd also recognizes the exceptional skills, discipline and dedication of those who serve - and those who stand beside them. Whether you’re a veteran, active-duty service member transitioning to civilian life, or a military spouse, your unique experience brings incredible value to our team. Military members, veterans, and military spouses are strongly encouraged to apply.


Don’t meet every requirement? If you are excited about this role but your experience does not align perfectly with all the qualifications, we encourage you to apply anyway. Experience comes in many forms, and you may be the perfect candidate for this or other roles.


Five Reasons to Work with Us:


Work with a leader in financial services industry

Supportive & flexible remote or hybrid environment

Diverse & friendly culture

Fast paced growing company

A company that cares with community service efforts

What You Will Be Doing:


As a member of the DevOps team, you will be working to support the build and deployment infrastructure and processes for RegEd’s web-based SaaS applications. You will work with a team of engineers, product managers, and other professionals to identify and resolve risks and problems for all stakeholders in RegEd’s SaaS solutions. Ultimately, your goal as a DevOps Engineer is to work with these myriad teams to create a more streamlined and efficient development process.


Responsibilities:


Execution of tasks in DevOps roadmap

Execution of tasks in accordance with DevOps policies and procedures using RegEd-approved approaches, promoting consistency and stability across all products

Coordinating activities with other staff to ensure that schedules are met

Participate in training sessions with staff on DevOps best practices where needed; fostering a mindset of upskilling among staff to prepare to meet future requirements

Evangelizing the mindset of DevOps as a rigorous discipline to help stakeholders become aware of problems and risks

Fostering process improvement through an “Automation First” approach

Facilitating test automation across all quality engineering and development staff

Working with management to conduct internal audits of the company’s DevOps methods to identify potential problems and recommend solutions will improve efficiency in processes

Proactively reports team status and results to management

Eliminating or escalating issues impeding team progress

Gathering and reporting key performance indicators and metrics for process improvement

Participation in readiness and go/no-go conversations and decisions

Promoting and implementing continuous process improvement, including the adoption of best practices within the DevOps organization

Working with management to onboard/offboard contractors and consultants needed

Work with management to evaluate new technologies and tools to determine suitability for use and executing their rollout

Staying current with software engineering industry trends and best practices, and working with team leadership on their adoption

Review/Implement recommendations for containing or reducing operating costs, tool consolidation


Must Have:


Experience developing, implementing and maintaining various automation pipeline functions (CI/CD, Appbuild/delivery, DB build/delivery)

Experience in Build and Release Engineering in a diverse development environment

History of performing hands-on Azure work to solve complex technical problems.

Experience developing, implementing and using DevOps tools

Tools/Frameworks - Azure DevOps, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform, Jenkins, Docker, Git, Kubernetes, Github Actions

Languages/Scripting - YAML, PowerShell, SQL, Python, Bash, C#, Java

Experience with NX Monorepo – in a .Net environment - preferred

Experience with Liquibase a plus

Experience in supporting Azure computing infrastructure, data implementation, networking; implementation, and solutions by using Azure platform services.

Ability to work on a team spanning multiple disciplines as well as independently to achieve team goals.


Nice To Have:


RegTech Experience.

FinTech Experience.

Capital Markets Knowledge.

Insurance Industry Knowledge.


The Process:


We can hire in the following states: Alabama, Arizona, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Mississippi, Missouri, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Virginia, Washington (state) and Wisconsin.

Any communications related to open RegEd positions will come from a RegEd.com email address. We do not hire through text message, social media, or email alone. Our interviews are conducted either in person or via video calls. We will not ask you for sensitive information nor will we ask you to pay anything during the hiring process.


Apply! (3-25 minutes)

Resume review (up to 2 weeks)

Brief video interview with RegEd Recruiting Team Member (30 minutes)

Video interview with Hiring Manager (30-60 minutes)

Video interview with Team Members (60 minutes)

Offer

Background check and drug test (2-5 days)

Onboarding, yay!


Welcome to RegEd!


The Perks:


Competitive pay and bonus

Remote (and hybrid if near Morrisville, NC) first organization

Exceptional medical, dental and vision plans with generous employer funding for employees and dependents

401(k) plan with company matching

Generous flexible time off

Company paid life insurance

Flexible Spending Accounts: Medical and Dependent Care

Leave benefits including short-term and long-term disability, paid family medical leave and paid parental leave

Volunteering time off and flexible schedules

Professional development

Meaningful career growth opportunities

Performance bonuses

Great working environment with a team of fantastic people


Learn more at www.RegEd.com.


If you are interested in joining a market leader and innovator poised for exponential new business growth in the coming years, please apply. It’s a great time to join the RegEd Team!


Pay Transparency:


The compensation range for this position is $100,000 - $150,000


RegEd takes a market-based approach to pay. Your actual pay is based on your unique background, pertinent experience, work location and qualifications. In addition to competitive base pay and bonus program participation, RegEd’s total compensation package also includes our comprehensive benefits package in addition to vacation, sick, volunteer time off and paid parental leave.


Accommodation:


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the interview process, perform essential job functions and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you need an accommodation in order to interview, please let us know during any of your interactions with the RegEd Recruiting Team. This information will be treated as confidential and only used to determine appropriate accommodation for the interview process.


Equal Opportunity Policy (EEO):


At RegEd, we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class. RegEd is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Workplace.

Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.

RegEd does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Software Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Software Data Engineer focused on macro data – remote fund (US-based) - up to $200k - 220k base - fully remote role (ideally East Coast)


A leading investment fund seeking a Senior Data Engineer to join their team in a fully remote capacity. The role will focus on building and scaling data infrastructure to empower Portfolio Managers, Researchers, and Analysts with the tools and datasets they need for research and decision-making.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and infrastructure to support investment research and trading strategies.
  • Ingest, normalise, and manage large-scale financial datasets from vendors such as Bloomberg, Refinitiv, and other market data providers.
  • Collaborate closely with PMs, researchers, and analysts to understand data requirements and deliver solutions that enable faster, more reliable research workflows.
  • Implement best practices for data quality, governance, and security across the research data platform.
  • Leverage cloud technologies and infrastructure-as-code (e.g. Terraform) to ensure reliable, scalable, and cost-effective data environments.
  • Contribute to continuous improvements in architecture, tooling, and automation across the data stack.


Requirements:

  • 6+ years’ experience as a Data Engineer, ideally within buy-side, sell-side, or other financial services environments.
  • Strong programming skills in Python and proficiency in SQL.
  • Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS or Azure) and modern data tools such as Snowflake or equivalent.
  • Proven track record of market data ingestion and management, including Bloomberg and Refinitiv datasets.
  • Solid understanding of infrastructure-as-code tools (Terraform preferred).
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to partner directly with investment teams.


Compensation & Location:

  • Base salary: up to $200k–220k.
  • Fully remote role – candidates must be based in the US (East Coast strongly preferred).

companySlogan: Expert talent advisory and delivery for the global AI, tech, quantitative finance, crypto and data-science communities
companyDescription:
Durlston Partners began recruiting for the world's top talent-driven Hedge Funds in 2010. 
 
Today we have 120+ clients across AI / Machine Learning, Hedge Funds, HFT’s, Private Equity, Digital Assets and FinTechs, operating globally with offices in London, New York and Dubai. 
 
In 2015 we started building ML / AI driven firms in New York and London. In 2016 were the first to move into the crypto space, building founding member teams to today’s institutions.  
 
Over the past 15 years we have built deep networks across AI / ML, software engineering, quant trading / finance, and data scientists. Talent that cannot be reached through job adverts or Linked-in. 
 
We are currently building out the UAE’s talent pool in an exciting and fast-growing market.  
 
For market information, talent trends, fund raising or general talent advice please get in touch: hello@durlstonpartners.com

title: Systems Staff Engineer - z/OS
descriptionHtml:
At CVS Health, we’re building a world of health around every consumer and surrounding ourselves with dedicated colleagues who are passionate about transforming health care.


As the nation’s leading health solutions company, we reach millions of Americans through our local presence, digital channels and more than 300,000 purpose-driven colleagues – caring for people where, when and how they choose in a way that is uniquely more connected, more convenient and more compassionate. And we do it all with heart, each and every day.


Position Summary


We are seeking an exceptional Systems Staff Engineer - z/OS with a proven track record in z/OS software lifecycle methodologies across diverse vendor solutions. The ideal candidate will demonstrate a high level of adaptability to evolving priorities and a commitment to delivering innovative, data-driven business solutions. This role will also involve taking a leadership position in overseeing and enhancing audit compliance, and proactive remediation of vulnerabilities. The Systems Staff Engineer will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and implement sophisticated custom solutions that not only meet but exceed business needs.


Key Responsibilities


  • Expert Management: Maintain and manage a comprehensive suite of multi-vendor z/OS software products, ensuring optimal performance and reliability.
  • Advanced Utilization: Leverage a wide array of z/OS products and utilities to drive efficiency and innovation within the organization.
  • Best Practice Development: Develop and deploy cutting-edge best practice solutions that align with strategic business objectives and drive measurable outcomes.
  • Complex Problem Resolution: Provide expert support for intricate technical and operational challenges, employing advanced root cause analysis to drive effective problem resolution.
  • Audit Compliance Leadership: Produce comprehensive control evidence for various audit inquiries, ensuring adherence to regulatory standards and best practices.
  • Vendor Collaboration: Engage with vendors to strategically plan and implement z/OS system upgrades, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
  • Change and Problem Management: Work effectively within Change and Problem Management frameworks to facilitate smooth transitions and minimize disruptions.
  • Continuity and Recovery Planning: Lead the development and execution of robust continuity and recovery plans, ensuring organizational resilience.
  • On-Call Support: Participate in an on-call rotation, providing expert support as needed to maintain operational integrity.


Required Qualifications


  • Extensive Experience: 7+ years of experience in large-scale Mainframe computing environments, demonstrating a deep understanding of system architecture and operations.
  • Lifecycle Management Expertise: 7+ years of experience with z/OS software lifecycle management, showcasing a history of successful project delivery and system enhancements.
  • Automation Proficiency: 5+ years of experience with IBM Systems Automation and NetView deployment and customization, with a focus on optimizing operational efficiency.
  • Security Product Expertise: 5+ years of experience in deploying and customizing Mainframe security products, with a strong emphasis on risk mitigation and compliance.


Preferred Qualifications


  • Database Optimization: Strong understanding of database optimization and performance tuning, with a proven ability to enhance system efficiency.
  • Mentorship and Leadership: Experience in mentoring and guiding junior engineers, fostering a culture of continuous learning, innovation, and skill enhancement.
  • Strategic Alignment: A strong strategic mindset with the ability to align IT initiatives with overarching business goals, driving significant value through technology.
  • Disaster Recovery Mastery: Deep knowledge of disaster recovery planning, implementation, and testing within IBM environments, with a focus on best practices and continuous improvement.
  • Vendor Management Expertise: Strong experience in vendor management, contract negotiation, and third-party software integration, ensuring optimal partnerships and resource utilization.


EDUCATION


Bachelor’s degree or, equivalent experience (HS diploma + 4 years relevant experience)


Pay Range


The Typical Pay Range For This Role Is


$118,450.00 - $284,280.00


This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above. This position also includes an award target in the company’s equity award program.


Our people fuel our future. Our teams reflect the customers, patients, members and communities we serve and we are committed to fostering a workplace where every colleague feels valued and that they belong.


Great Benefits For Great People


We take pride in our comprehensive and competitive mix of pay and benefits – investing in the physical, emotional and financial wellness of our colleagues and their families to help them be the healthiest they can be. In addition to our competitive wages, our great benefits include:


  • Affordable medical plan options, a 401(k) plan (including matching company contributions), and an employee stock purchase plan.
  • No-cost programs for all colleagues including wellness screenings, tobacco cessation and weight management programs, confidential counseling and financial coaching.
  • Benefit solutions that address the different needs and preferences of our colleagues including paid time off, flexible work schedules, family leave, dependent care resources, colleague assistance programs, tuition assistance, retiree medical access and many other benefits depending on eligibility.


For more information, visit https://jobs.cvshealth.com/us/en/benefits


We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 07/04/2025


Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.

companySlogan: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health™
companyDescription:
CVS Health is the leading health solutions company, delivering care like no one else can. We reach more people and improve the health of communities across America through our local presence, digital channels and over 300,000 dedicated colleagues – including more than 40,000 physicians, pharmacists, nurses and nurse practitioners. 

Wherever and whenever people need us, we help them with their health – whether that’s managing chronic diseases, staying compliant with their medications or accessing affordable health and wellness services in the most convenient ways. We help people navigate the health care system – and their personal health care – by improving access, lowering costs and being a trusted partner for every meaningful moment of health. And we do it all with heart, each and every day. Follow @CVSHealth on social media.

title: Solution Architect / Consultant / or Sales Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Cyara is the world’s leading Automated CX Assurance Platform provider, helping leading brands across the globe deliver better CX with less effort, cost, and risk. Cyara supports the entire CX software development lifecycle, from design to functional and regression testing, load testing, chatbot testing, and production monitoring, ensuring enterprises can build flawless customer journeys across voice and digital channels while reducing the risk of customer-facing defects. Every day, the most recognizable brands across the globe trust Cyara to deliver customer smiles at scale. Interested to find out more about us? Check out: www.cyara.com


Want to know what it’s really like to work at Cyara? Check out this link to meet some real Cyaran’s and read about their individual career journey with us: https://cyara.com/employee-profiles/


Cyara’s Diversity, Equity, Inclusive and Belonging Statement:

At Cyara, we are dedicated to fostering a workplace that embodies equal opportunity and champions diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB). We strive to cultivate an environment where every individual feels valued, respected, and empowered to bring their whole selves to work, contributing unique perspectives and talents. Our commitment includes continuously evaluating and enhancing our policies, practices, and culture to align with our DEIB principles. We ensure a discrimination-free environment where individuals are evaluated solely on their merits and abilities, regardless of legally protected statuses such as sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or medical condition. By celebrating our differences and championing inclusivity, we enrich our organization, make more thoughtful decisions, and drive collective success.


Cyara’s Values Statement: At Cyara, our values shape everything we do. We're passionate about Delivering Excellence by putting the customer first, collaborating globally, and always striving to improve. We take smart risks and Innovate Boldly, setting new standards and learning from every experience. Integrity First is our cornerstone—we value humility, authenticity, and respect for diversity, building trust in all we do. We Embrace Curiosity by empowering you to experiment, learn, and grow in a dynamic environment. At Cyara, our values drive us forward, shaping a culture where innovation and excellence thrive.


We are looking for an experienced Sr. Solutions Architect to join our dynamic team. This role involves working closely with sales teams to architect solutions that meet prospective customers' complex requirements, demonstrating the value of Cyara in enhancing their CX strategies. You will be instrumental in building trust with potential customers, understanding their needs, and designing tailored solutions that highlight the capabilities and benefits of Cyara's testing and monitoring solutions.


Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with sales teams to understand prospective customers' business challenges and technical requirements, aligning them with Cyara solutions.
  • Develop and present customized demonstrations of Cyara's platform, highlighting its value in improving CX testing and monitoring.
  • Architect and propose solutions that integrate Cyara's platform with customers' existing technology stacks, ensuring seamless operation and optimization of their CX strategies.
  • Engage with customer stakeholders to gather requirements, discuss potential solutions, and provide expert advice on Cyara's capabilities.
  • Respond to technical queries and concerns during the sales process, ensuring customers' and prospects' technical requirements are addressed effectively.
  • Stay updated with the latest developments in CX technologies, Cyara platform updates, and industry best practices to provide insightful recommendations to customers.
  • Facilitate smooth transition of new customers to the implementation team, ensuring clear communication of the proposed solutions and customer expectations.
  • Contribute to the development of best practices, case studies, and other materials to enhance the pre-sales process and highlight the value of Cyara solutions.


Let’s talk about your skills/expertise:

  • 4+ Years in a presale's role presenting to C and V level prospects.
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field experience.
  • Proven experience as a Solutions Architect, Sales Engineer, or similar role, preferably with a focus on CX, call centre, IVR or related technologies.
  • Strong technical acumen, with the ability to design solutions and integrate complex systems.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with a proven ability to engage and persuade technical and business audiences.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a consultative approach to addressing customer needs.
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with sales teams and other internal stakeholders.
  • Willingness to travel as needed to meet with customers, tradeshows, corporate events globally and participate in sales engagements.


$116,000- $132,000 a year

This range indicates OTE. Individual pay is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location.


Why you should join us:

At Cyara you’ll have the opportunity to work with a group of people who share common goals, are driven by a similar passion, and value the expertise of their peers. Cyara is committed to being an equal opportunity employer, focused on building and maintaining a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace; and a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment, based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy. At Cyara we appreciate and welcome the fact that our culture is living and growing as we continue to evolve over time. With this opportunity comes the chance to enjoy a flexible work environment, competitive compensation and a work culture that's results-oriented, fast-paced and focused on continuous improvement, whilst maintaining a family first, team oriented, and ever positive atmosphere.


Cyara cares for its own - you’ll feel that on your first day - and you'll get the chance to work for a global, growing company, and an all-inclusive team of innovators. We credit our amazing growth and success to the fact that we’ve built our business on four essential values that we live and breathe every day:

Deliver Excellence

Innovate Boldly

Integrity First

Embrace Curiosity

companySlogan: Cyara's AI-Powered CX Transformation Platform Helps Businesses Evolve to Meet Customers' Expectations
companyDescription:
Cyara revolutionizes the way businesses transform and optimize their customer experiences. Cyara’s AI-based CX Transformation Platform empowers enterprises to deliver flawless interactions across voice, video, digital, and chatbot experiences. With Cyara, businesses improve customer journeys through continuous innovation while reducing cost and minimizing risk. With a 96% customer retention rate and world-class Net Promoter Score (NPS), today’s leading global brands trust Cyara every day to deliver customer smiles at scale.

To learn more, visit cyara.com

title: Lead Solutions Engineer
descriptionHtml:
DriveWealth is a global B2B financial technology organization dedicated to democratizing access to financial independence around the world. Our mission is realized through an API-based platform, empowering our partners to offer seamless investing and trading experiences to clients worldwide, all from their mobile devices.

Our technology provides partners with a modern, extensible toolkit, enabling traditional investment workflows and innovative techniques like fractional share ownership. DriveWealth has evolved into a global platform offering trading of US equities, mutual funds, ETFs, fixed income, and options.

We seek enthusiastic professionals to contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to our Brokerage-as-a-Service platform. Our culture blends the pace and opportunity of a tech start-up with the impact, stability, and significance of Wall Street. We encourage creativity and experimentation while ensuring institutional-grade execution and regulatory compliance in everything we do. We value diversity and inclusion, celebrating the unique differences of our employees as we scale and grow together. We’re guided by operating principles grounded in accountability, teamwork, integrity, and solutions built to scale. Join us!

About The Role

The Solutions Engineer plays a pivotal role in DriveWealth's growth and expansion by leading the API integration of new partners, educating on new products, and identifying processes that can be automated to optimize team and partner efficiency.

What You’ll Do

  • Identify and implement process improvements that maximize time efficiency for DriveWealth employees and partners. Use your strong programming knowledge to quickly implement new automation in ServiceNow, Github, and other ancillary programs
  • Define and document repeatable processes, ensuring operational efficiency and scalability while maintaining a keen eye for detail and quality assurance
  • Collaborate closely with internal teams, including sales, finance, product, technology, and operations, to develop cohesive strategies that prioritize partner success and drive revenue growth
  • Align closely with partners who will be integrating DriveWealths API. Use your robust programming knowledge to provide education, project management, and architecture support while maintaining positive partner relationships
  • Establish a culture of mutual accountability between the Relationship Management team and partners. Advocate for their needs and marshal resources to support them while aligning with DriveWealth's overarching vision
  • Use your debugging skills to identify pain points and reported bugs by partners while suggesting and introducing changes to our product team

What You’ll Need

  • Five years of experience in software development, with a focus on the implementation of APIs
  • Proficiency in full stack development, with working knowledge of cloud-based platform tools such as AWS and/or Google Cloud Platform
  • Proficiency in implementing event-based programs, working with tools such as Apache Kafka and AWS SQS
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong time management abilities with the capacity to prioritize and manage multiple partner engagements concurrently
  • Proven problem-solving skills and meticulous attention to detail
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and external partners
  • Customer-centric mindset with a commitment to ensuring client success and satisfaction
  • Proactive, self-motivated, and capable of working independently while taking ownership of client relationships
  • You thrive in a fast-paced environment and can deliver results under pressure
  • You are driven by a passion for partner success and business growth

Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. DriveWealth is unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time

Compensation

Compensation package offerings are based on candidate experience and technical qualifications, as it relates to the role. These are identified and determined throughout your interviewing experience.

Please note: at this time, we are not able to hire in all states.

Remote (Most US States) Pay Range

$145,000—$160,000 USD

Benefits

  • Competitive medical, dental, and vision insurance options
  • Mental health resources
  • Generous paid time off with observed holidays (varies per country)
  • Paid parental leave for biological and adoptive parents
  • Up to $2,500 or local equivalent each year to invest in continued education and personal development
  • Up to $900 each year or local equivalent for fitness and wellness reimbursement
  • Company-provided phone (varies by country)
  • Hybrid work experience that allows for flexibility
  • For HQ in-office employees, a daily lunch stipend, unlimited snacks, and engaging office space in the Financial District
  • Pre-tax commuter benefits (US only)
  • Employer 401K match (US only)

Benefit offerings vary based on country and are subject to change.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

TO ALL AGENCIES: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of DriveWealth outside of the Talent organization. DriveWealth’s policy is to only accept resumes from agencies via Greenhouse (ATS). Agencies must have a valid services agreement executed and must have been assigned by the Talent team to a specific requisition. Any resume submitted outside of this process will be deemed the sole property of DriveWealth. In the event a candidate submitted outside of this policy is hired, no fee or payment will be paid.

Use your strong programming knowledge to quickly implement new automation in ServiceNow, Github, and other ancillary programsDefine and document repeatable processes, ensuring operational efficiency and scalability while maintaining a keen eye for detail and quality assuranceCollaborate closely with internal teams, including sales, finance, product, technology, and operations, to develop cohesive strategies that prioritize partner success and drive revenue growthAlign closely with partners who will be integrating DriveWealths API. Use your robust programming knowledge to provide education, project management, and architecture support while maintaining positive partner relationshipsEstablish a culture of mutual accountability between the Relationship Management team and partners. Advocate for their needs and marshal resources to support them while aligning with DriveWealth's overarching visionUse your debugging skills to identify pain points and reported bugs by partners while suggesting and introducing changes to our product teamWhat You’ll NeedFive years of experience in software development, with a focus on the implementation of APIsProficiency in full stack development, with working knowledge of cloud-based platform tools such as AWS and/or Google Cloud PlatformProficiency in implementing event-based programs, working with tools such as Apache Kafka and AWS SQS Exceptional written and verbal communication skillsStrong time management abilities with the capacity to prioritize and manage multiple partner engagements concurrentlyProven problem-solving skills and meticulous attention to detailAbility to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and external partnersCustomer-centric mindset with a commitment to ensuring client success and satisfactionProactive, self-motivated, and capable of working independently while taking ownership of client relationshipsYou thrive in a fast-paced environment and can deliver results under pressureYou are driven by a passion for partner success and business growthApplicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. DriveWealth is unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this timeCompensationCompensation package offerings are based on candidate experience and technical qualifications, as it relates to the role. These are identified and determined throughout your interviewing experience.Please note: at this time, we are not able to hire in all states.Remote (Most US States) Pay Range$145,000—$160,000 USDBenefitsCompetitive medical, dental, and vision insurance optionsMental health resources Generous paid time off with observed holidays (varies per country)Paid parental leave for biological and adoptive parentsUp to $2,500 or local equivalent each year to invest in continued education and personal developmentUp to $900 each year or local equivalent for fitness and wellness reimbursementCompany-provided phone (varies by country)Hybrid work experience that allows for flexibilityFor HQ in-office employees, a daily lunch stipend, unlimited snacks, and engaging office space in the Financial DistrictPre-tax commuter benefits (US only)Employer 401K match (US only)Benefit offerings vary based on country and are subject to change.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.TO ALL AGENCIES: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of DriveWealth outside of the Talent organization. DriveWealth’s policy is to only accept resumes from agencies via Greenhouse (ATS). Agencies must have a valid services agreement executed and must have been assigned by the Talent team to a specific requisition. Any resume submitted outside of this process will be deemed the sole property of DriveWealth. In the event a candidate submitted outside of this policy is hired, no fee or payment will be paid.

title: Software Engineer
descriptionHtml:
I'm currently working with a Houston-based IT services company that delivers high-impact technology solutions to the oil and gas industry. They’re growing their engineering team and are actively looking for a C++ Software Engineer to join them on exciting platform-focused development work.


This is a direct hire opportunity with a company that builds cutting-edge solutions involving real-time systems, industrial communication protocols, and cloud-connected services.


What they're looking for:

  • 3–5+ years of professional experience writing C++ code
  • Strong software development fundamentals and a desire to keep growing professionally
  • Solid understanding of systems-level programming


Nice to have (not required, but great if you have it):

  • Experience working with TCP/IP socket-based communication
  • Protocol development or implementation work
  • IIoT/MQTT development experience
  • Familiarity with Docker, containerization, or cloud-native development
  • Experience building and maintaining Windows or Linux services
  • Prior exposure to platform-style software architecture or large-scale systems
  • Oil and gas or industrial systems background is a plus


What’s in it for you:

  • Work with a forward-thinking team building real-world solutions for industrial clients
  • Flexible work environment (hybrid preferred, remote possible)
  • Competitive compensation and benefits
  • Opportunity to work on platform-level architecture and cloud/edge software systems
  • Direct access to leadership and technical decision-makers


If you're a skilled C++ developer with a systems mindset and you're looking for a high-impact role in the oil and gas space, I’d love to connect.

title: Data Center Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Are you a Solutions/Architect Engineer/Data Center Infrastructure Engineer or someone you know interested in working with digital services company? This role has excellent benefits; equity options, unlimited bonus, 100% medical, dental and matched 401k. Client will hire in September, and interviews are scheduled ASAP (3 step interview process with immediate feedback from Client).

Contact me today if you have the below requirements:


  • 10+ years in a customer-facing technical role such as Sales Engineer, Solutions Architect, or Datacenter Infrastructure Engineer.
  • Strong understanding of datacenter infrastructure: power distribution (including high-density and redundant configurations), rack/cage layouts, structured cabling, and HVAC/cooling systems.
  • Familiarity with interconnection strategies, including metro/long haul fiber, Internet Exchange (IX), cloud on-ramps, and Layer 2 fabric connectivity.
  • Ability to create and present detailed technical documentation (diagrams, layouts, heat/power specs).
  • Skilled at translating technical requirements into actionable scope for delivery and quoting.pro
  • Experience working directly with carriers, hyperscalers, content platforms, or CDNs.
  • Knowledge of BGP routing, peering, cross-connect provisioning, and basic networking design principles.
  • Understanding of thermal/cooling strategies including air containment, rear door heat exchangers, and direct-to-chip liquid cooling.
  • Proficiency with tools like Visio, AutoCAD, Excel (for power/cooling calculations), and CRM systems.


Please send resume today!



Elicia Bansuelo

Recruiting Manager

Technology Permanent Placement

Direct: 415-276-0360 | Connect with me: LinkedIn

Robert Half | 50 California St, 10th Floor | San Francisco | CA 94111 USA | roberthalf.com
